Package game.model

Class ClientServerThread

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
game.model.ClientServerThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ClientServerThread extends Thread
Class to handle network communication between server and client. This class extend thread from java, and will be used for both server and client.
Author:
Yohanes Kirana

    • ClientServerThread

      private ClientServerThread(Game4GewinnModel model)
      Create a new thread for the communication between server and client.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public static ClientServerThread startGame(Game4GewinnModel model)
      Start a game without knowing if the object a server or a client. It will be used for the beginning of view of game.
      Parameters:
      model - The model Object that should be used by ClientServerThread.
      Returns:
      a clientServerThread object.

    • newServer

      public ClientServerThread newServer(int port)
      Start a new sever connection with given port number.
      Parameters:
      port - The given port number to start the server connection.
      Returns:
      a clientServerThread object.

    • newClient

      public ClientServerThread newClient(String ip, int port)
      Start a new client connection with given port number.
      Parameters:
      ip - The given ip address of the client.
      port - The given port number that is identical to server's port.
      Returns:
      a clientServerThread object.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Check if the server is connected with a client.
      Returns:
      True if connected, false otherwise.

    • streamMove

      public void streamMove(int n)
      stream a move that is made by server or client as an object.
      Parameters:
      n - Column number that is inserted by player.

    • run

      public void run()
      Run method that execute the thread. Thread will allow server to accept one client if server does not have one. Server and client will read the stream which contains movement of another player. The move is then sent to the view to appear in the window.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread
